section.title: Features Overview
section.para: The aim of this section is to guide you in using LiveReload Tools:

listitem.para: Create a LiveReload server to receive information from the IDE on resource changes
Configure LiveReload for use with system web browsers and external devices
View resources in LiveReload-enabled web browsers, including system and external device browsers and BrowserSim

section.title: Create a LiveReload Server
section.para: The LiveReload server is integral to the LiveReload integration with the IDE. In its default configuration, the server receives information from the IDE when resources change and sends notifications for refresh actions to be taken. The server may also be further configured to inject the necessary JavaScript code snippets into HTML files or enable remote connections. The procedure below guides you through creating a default LiveReload server.

step.para: In the Servers tab, click create a new server or right-click an existing server and click New→Server.
From the list of server types, expand Basic and select LiveReload Server.

figure.title: LiveReload Server Selected in New Server Wizard

textobject.phrase: From the list of server types, expand Basic and select LiveReload Server.

step.para: The Server's host name and Server name fields are automatically populated. The localhost value in the Server's host name field indicates that the server is to be run on the local system and the value in the Server name field is the name by which the LiveReload server is identified in the Servers tab. You can edit these values as appropriate by typing in the fields.
Click Finish to close the window. The LiveReload server is listed in the Servers tab.

figure.title: LiveReload Server Listed in the Servers Tab

textobject.phrase: The LiveReload server is listed in the Servers tab.

note.para: Alternatively, LiveReload servers can be automatically created when you select to view workspace and deployed resources in web browsers using the actions provided by LiveReload Tools.

section.title: Configure the LiveReload Server
section.para: A LiveReload client must be inserted into HTML files in order for it to receive the LiveReload server notifications about changed resources. LiveReload Tools provides additional configuration options so that the LiveReload server can inject the necessary <script> element into the HTML resources. Furthermore, the LiveReload server can be configured to allow access from external devices, enabling LiveReload to function in browsers of remote devices.

The details below outline how to set the configuration options using the Server Editor. To open the Server Editor for a LiveReload server, in the Servers tab double-click the LiveReload server. Alternatively, right-click the LiveReload server and click Open or press F3.

figure.title: LiveReload Server Options in the Server Editor

textobject.phrase: The details below outline how to set the configuration options using the Server Editor. To open the Server Editor for a LiveReload server, in the Servers tab double-click the LiveReload server. Alternatively, right-click the LiveReload server and click Open or press F3.

varlistentry.term: Insert JavaScript code snippet to resources

listitem.para: In the Server Editor under LiveReload Server Configuration, select the Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages check box.

varlistentry.term: Enable LiveReload in external device browsers

listitem.para: In the Server Editor under LiveReload Server Configuration, select the Allow Remote Connections check box. This option is disabled by default when a LiveReload server is created as it exposes your workspace files, which may not always be desirable.

section.para: All changes to the settings of a LiveReload server must be saved and the server restarted before the results will take effect. To save setting changes, press Ctrl+S or click File→Save or click the Save icon. To restart the server, in the Servers tab right-click the LiveReload server and click Restart.

section.title: View Resources in LiveReload-enabled Browsers
section.para: You can use the actions of LiveReload Tools to open resources in browsers with LiveReload enabled, as detailed below. Note that if the requisite LiveReload server does not exist or is not correctly configured, you are prompted by LiveReload Tools, which can complete the necessary requirements for you.

varlistentry.term: View workspace resources on an external device

listitem.para: In the Project Explorer tab, right-click the HTML file and click Open With→Web Browser via LiveReload Server.

figure.title: Open With→Web Browser via LiveReload Server Menu Option

textobject.phrase: In the Project Explorer tab, right-click the HTML file and click Open With→Web Browser via LiveReload Server.

listitem.para: This requires the server to be configured to Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages and, if the server is not correctly configured, you are prompted to enable this option.

textobject.phrase: This requires the server to be configured to Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages and, if the server is not correctly configured, you are prompted to enable this option.

listitem.para: The IDE-specified external web browser opens, with LiveReload activated, and displays the workspace resource.

varlistentry.term: View deployed resources in a system browser

listitem.para: Ensure the server and application of the deployed resources are started. In the Servers tab, right-click the application and click Show In→Web Browser via LiveReload Server.

figure.title: Show In→Web Browser via LiveReload Server Menu Option

textobject.phrase: Ensure the server and application of the deployed resources are started. In the Servers tab, right-click the application and click Show In→Web Browser via LiveReload Server.

listitem.para: This requires the server to be configured to Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages and, if the server is not correctly configured, you are prompted to enable this option.

textobject.phrase: This requires the server to be configured to Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages and, if the server is not correctly configured, you are prompted to enable this option.

listitem.para: The IDE-specified external web browser opens, with LiveReload activated, and displays the deployed resource.

note.para: To change the IDE-specified external web browser, click Window→Preferences and expand General→Web Browser. From the External web browsers list, select the browser to use for actions involving external web browsers. Click Apply and click OK to close the window.

varlistentry.term: View deployed resources on an external device

listitem.para: Ensure the server and application of the deployed resources are started. In the Servers tab, right-click the application and click Show In→Web Browser on External Device.

figure.title: Show In→Web Browser on External Device Menu Option

textobject.phrase: Ensure the server and application of the deployed resources are started. In the Servers tab, right-click the application and click Show In→Web Browser on External Device.

listitem.para: This requires the server to be configured to Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages and Allow Remote Connections and, if the server is not correctly configured, you are prompted to enable these options.

textobject.phrase: This requires the server to be configured to Inject the livereload.js script in HTML pages and Allow Remote Connections and, if the server is not correctly configured, you are prompted to enable these options.

listitem.para: A QR code and LiveReload server port URL corresponding to the deployed application are displayed and these can be input into external device browsers.

figure.title: URL and QR Code for LiveReload in External Devices

textobject.phrase: A QR code and LiveReload server port URL corresponding to the deployed application are displayed and these can be input into external device browsers.

note.para: The configuration of a LiveReload server can be viewed and manually set in the Server Editor tab.

section.title: View Resources in LiveReload-enabled BrowserSim
section.para: The LiveReload server can be used in conjunction with BrowserSim. In this case, the server sends notifications about changed resources and BrowserSim inserts the JavaScript code, which invokes the simulated device browser window to refresh. The procedure below outlines how to enable LiveReload in BrowserSim for workspace and deployed resources.

step.para: Ensure the LiveReload server is started. If it is not started, in the Servers tab right-click the LiveReload server and click Start.
Complete the appropriate step depending on the location of your resources:
For workspace resources, in the Project Explorer tab right-click the .html file and click Open With→BrowserSim.
For deployed resources, in the Servers tab right-click the application and click Show In→BrowserSim.

textobject.phrase: For deployed resources, in the Servers tab right-click the application and click Show In→BrowserSim.

important.para: Ensure the server and application of the deployed resources are started before attempting to view the resources in LiveReload-enabled BrowserSim. To start the server and the application, in the Servers tab right-click each and click Start.

step.para: Right-click the simulated device and ensure the Enable LiveReload check box is selected.

figure.title: Enable LiveReload Check Box for BrowserSim

textobject.phrase: Right-click the simulated device and ensure the Enable LiveReload check box is selected.

important.para: The Enable LiveReload check box has no effect when the LiveReload server is set to insert the JavaScript code and the web resource is viewed in BrowserSim via the LiveReload server port URL. LiveReload is always enabled in this case.
